body.name: UBeesize 75inch roll Large Copper Oven Liners for Bottom of Oven BPA and PFOA Free,Thick Heavy Duty Non Stick Teflon Oven Mats for Electric, Gas, Toaster，Convection, Microwave Ovens and Grills
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 7 hrs 44 mins
features: 🍞𝐊𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐭𝐥𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐥𝐲 𝐜𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐧 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐧𝐨𝐧-𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐜𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐞𝐫 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐬! They catch drips, cheese, sauces, and other baked messes, making cleaning a breeze. Plus, you can wash them in the dishwasher for easy maintenance.

🍕𝐂𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐳𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐢𝐳𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐡𝐚𝐩𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐚𝐫𝐠𝐞 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐟𝐢𝐭 𝐚𝐧𝐲 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧 𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐢𝐫 𝐟𝐫𝐲𝐞𝐫. Simply trim them to size or tile them together for larger ovens. They're perfect for all sizes of ovens and air fryers.

🍗𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐫 𝐮𝐬𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐦𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐤𝐞𝐲!For gas and electric ovens with a hidden heating element, place the oven drip mat at the lowest rack of the oven and not on the oven floor. For electric ovens with an exposed heating element, place them underneath the heating element at the bottom of the oven. Wash them with soap and water before using them for the very first time.

🍩𝐂𝐨𝐬𝐭-𝐞𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞:An oven liner is an affordable way to extend the life of your oven and reduce cleaning time. Instead of spending money on expensive cleaning products or replacing your oven, you can invest in an oven liner that will protect your oven for years to come.

🍢𝐍𝐨𝐭 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐧𝐬! Our copper oven mats can also be used as pan liners, air fryer liners, grill mats, baking mats, cooking sheets, or gas stove protection pads. They're versatile and perfect for all your cooking needs.
body.description: Introducing our high-quality copper oven liners rollThe perfect solution to protect your oven from spills and drips while making cleaning up after cooking a breeze. Our oven protectors for bottom of oven are made from premium materials that are heat-resistant and safe to use, ensuring that your oven stays clean and in good condition for years to come.Our oven liners are easy to install, simply place them on the bottom of your oven and you're done. Available in different sizes and shapes, they fit perfectly with most ovens and can be easily cut to fit if needed. Their non-stick surface ensures that any food debris or liquid is caught, making cleaning up after cooking a quick and easy task.Our oven liners are designed to be safe for use, even at high temperatures. They're made from materials that won't emit harmful fumes or chemicals when heated, ensuring the safety of you and your family. Investing in our oven liners is a cost-effective way to extend the life of your oven, as well as reduce your cleaning time. Instead of spending money on expensive cleaning products or replacing your oven, you can simply use our oven liners to catch any mess, making cleaning up after cooking a breeze.Overall, our oven liners are a must-have accessory for anyone who wants to protect their oven and make cleaning up after cooking easier. Try them out today and see the difference they can make in keeping your oven clean and in top condition.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: High-Quality This oven mat is made by combining fiberglass cloth and polytetrafluoroethylene, or PTFE. No dangerous chemicals like PFOA or silicone. High Temperature Resistant Keep your home safe with UBeesize's high temperature resistant oven liners, which can withstand up to 500°F (260°C) without burning. Keep the liner away from the oven's heating element. If the oven's heating element is at the bottom, avoid placing the liner on it. Instead, put it on a lower shelf at least one inch away from the heating element to prevent damage caused by higher temperatures near the heater than the set temperature in the oven.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Can cut to size
reviews.reviewText: Durable, easy to clean, easy to size

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Fits like a glove on my GE flat surface stove/oven. It does state that this is not recommended for use in convection ovens. My GE is not (thank goodness because I had convection in my beach house and hated it). It fit perfect and I have used the oven a dozen times and no issues. Looks like it wipes easily but you can also pull out and handwash. I feel like its a good buy. You get two mats with this one and its nice to have a back up just in case. :) Happy shopping.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very impressive item. Looks great in the oven and really does the job. Easy to wash off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, but no for gas oven
reviews.reviewText: I had to buy a new gas stove (and I just dare the appliance police to try and take it to gas stove jail). My old stove is 30 years old, and better than gas stove on the market now, the control panel died. My old stove has a removable oven bottom, I only had to take it outside and clean it like new. Easy!The new stove doesn't have that removal feature. I see myself on my knees, half way inside the oven to clean it. Poo! With that vision in my head, I decided that I need these oven liners. I bought the gold ones because I want more light in the oven. I was dubious about their durability when I took them out of the box, they are so thin. Since there are two, I cut one to fit inside my toaster oven. After I cut it to size, I throughly washed, rinsed and dried it. I don't want factory stuff smoking or smelling up my kitchen. Then I tested it. I set the toaster oven to 400° and let it heat for 15 minutes with no food or pans inside. Following the instructions for an electric oven, I put the liner on the crumb tray, below the heating elements. There's only about 3" between the heat element and the liner, so the liner is very close to the heat. I expected the liner to melt or catch fire. Didn't happen! Wahoo! Pot pies at 400°, pizza at 425°, dinner rolls (covered) on the 'keep warm' for 30 minutes ... all good! No problems with the liner. It's great that I don't have to keep replacing the protective foil. I can wash the liner and put it back in the toaster oven, no more replacing and wasting foil. I like how much quicker the liner is to clean and no wasting foil is great.The liner directives are different liner placement for electronic ovens and gas ovens. I can only review regarding my gas oven. The liner directive instructs gas oven placement should be on the lower of the two racks. I cut the liner to fit only over the solid floor of the oven, leaving the open flame vents clear, the flames would probably set the liner on fire. Later, before I used the oven for the first time, I read the full stove manual. According to the manual, the warranty is voided if a liner is used in the oven. I won't be using the liner in the gas oven.I've already cut this liner, but I can still use it in the toaster oven.The top gas burners have large, grill like grates, they are heavy and a pain to clean. I can put them in the dishwasher and that's fine, but here's the thing about the grates. When using the griddle in the middle, any food splatters grease on the unused grates. Sometimes, the splattered grease isn't a lot, but the grates still have to be cleaned to eliminate grease smells and buildup. I put foil over the grates, manual says, don't do that and explains about carbon monoxide build up. Okay, covering them tightly, I understand. I just gently laid the foil on to catch the grease. That's a lot of foil and I don't want to save it for multiple uses because it stinks of grease. I'm going to buy the longer length of this liner and cut it to lay on top of the grates. I hope that will work fine because they can tolerate indirect heat from the griddle and flame. I can easily wash the liner and not waste a lot of foil. I'm not suggesting that anyone do the same. I haven't tried it yet, so I don't know if my idea will be a safe thing to do. I like the liner and if I can use it to reduce cleanup, that's the point. If it doesn't work out, I'll have a lifetime supply of toaster oven liners. I will also use it as a mat for hot pans on my countertop.In case you missed it, there are two liners in the box. I'm guessing you'll eventually need to replace the liner, that's why there's two of them. I don't know how long the liners last, but two of them for the price is a good buy compared to other liner options. Since I've never used liners before, I'm on a learning curve.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have bought these more than once. They keep the oven bottom clean. The only thing I don’t like is they stain easily..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are working very well so far. I switched out the tin foil for this and it is far more durable, easier to clean and prevents the bottom of the oven from getting dirty. This was also easy to cut to size.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Functional Product
reviews.reviewText: These mats work so well, look great and clean up easily! I'm very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reusable and Easy to Clean
reviews.reviewText: You know how sometimes when you cook something like a pizza in the oven you’re supposed to put it right on the rack? What do you do if the stuff falls through the rack? Then it will get stuck on the bottom of your oven, which is such a pain to clean. I got tired of that happening so I decided to get these because I can cut them to the right size of my oven and if anything falls to the bottom these will catch it. Then I can just wait until the oven has cooled off, take these out and wash them off and use them again. It’s so, so much easier than having to get into the oven to clean it and because they’re non stick it’s super quick and easy. I like that they’re free of chemicals so I don’t have to worry about anything getting into my food when I cook and they withstand temperatures up to 500 degrees so I don’t have to worry about them burning. I also like that you can use them in other things aside from your oven, like your air fryer for example. That will make cleaning my air fryer so much easier, too. Oh, you can also use them on cookie sheets instead of foil, so that’s cool too.
